text: I prefer to avoid conflict whenever possible.
I am comfortable addressing conflicts directly and openly.
I believe compromise is essential to resolving disagreements.
I often try to mediate between others when they are in conflict.
I believe it is more important to maintain harmony than to "win" an argument.
I am willing to let go of minor issues to avoid escalating a disagreement.
I believe rules should be followed strictly in disputes.
I try to understand both sides of an argument before forming an opinion.
I think it is important to stand firm in disagreements to assert one's values.
I often try to find creative solutions to resolve conflicts.
I prioritize resolving conflicts quickly, even if it means making personal compromises.
I believe listening is more important than speaking during a disagreement.
I feel confident negotiating with others to resolve disputes.
I believe some conflicts cannot be resolved and should be left alone.
I avoid discussing difficult topics to keep relationships intact.
I try to ensure that all parties involved in a conflict feel heard.
I believe honesty is the most important factor in resolving disagreements.
I often rely on rules or procedures to settle conflicts.
I value fairness over maintaining personal relationships during disagreements.
I believe conflicts are opportunities to strengthen relationships.
